required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, Safety and Tolerability of After Administrations of DWP14012 Alone and Combinations of DWP14012, Clarithromycin and Amoxicillin in Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label, Multiple Dose, Two-part Phase I Clinical Trial to Compare the Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and Safety/Tolerability of DWP14012 After Administrations of DWP14012 Alone and Combinations of DWP14012, Clarithromycin and Amoxicillin in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label, multiple dose, two-part phase I clinical trial to compare the pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics and safety/tolerability of DWP14012 after administrations of DWP14012 alone and combinations of DWP14012, Clarithromycin and Amoxicillin in healthy male subjects

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax,ss: Maximum concentration of DWP14012, clarithromycin and metabolite and amoxicillin at steady state
primary_outcome.description: Part I: each period (Group A, B, C, D) Part II: Group A, B

primary_outcome.measure: Cmin,ss: Minimum concentration of DWP14012, clarithromycin and metabolite and amoxicillin at steady state
primary_outcome.description: Part I: each period (Group A, B, C, D) Part II: Group A, B

primary_outcome.measure: Cav,ss: Average concentration of DWP14012, clarithromycin and metabolite and amoxicillin at steady state
primary_outcome.description: Part I: each period (Group A, B, C, D) Part II: Group A, B

primary_outcome.measure: AUCt,ss: Area under the drug concentration-time curve within a dosing interval at steady states
primary_outcome.description: Part I: each period (Group A, B, C, D) Part II: Group A, B

primary_outcome.measure: Tmax,ss: Time of maximum concentration at steady state
primary_outcome.description: Part I: each period (Group A, B, C, D) Part II: Group A, B
Part I: each period (Group A, B, C, D) Part II: Group A, B

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of total time that the intragastric pH was above 4
primary_outcome.time_frame: Period 1 Day -1 and Group A, C Day 7 0~24 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of total time that the intragastric pH was above 4
Percentage of total time that the intragastric pH was above 6
primary_outcome.time_frame: Period 1 day -1 and Group A, C Day 7 0~24 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of total time that the intragastric pH was above 6

primary_outcome.time_frame: Period 1 Day -1 and Group A, C Day 7 pre-dose, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 hours
Day -1 pre-dose, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12 hours, Day 1 and 7 pre-dose, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Adverse Events (AE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day -2 (Randomization) to Day 60 (Post-study visit of Part I) and Day 42 (Follow up visit of Part II)
primary_outcome.description: All AE standardized using MedDRA was assessed by investigator using the protocol defined grading system. Intensity was categorized as mild, moderate and severe

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Vital Sign findings
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day -2 (Randomization) to Day 60 (Post-study visit of Part I) and Day 42 (Follow up visit of Part II)
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure(mmHg), pulse (beats/min) and body temperature(â„ƒ) were tested. The Average, Median, Standard Deviation, Min, Max values will be calculated to assess the safety/tolerability.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram(12-lead ECG) findings
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day -2 (Randomization) to Day 54~60 (Post-study visit of Part I) and Day 36~42 (Follow up visit of Part II)
primary_outcome.description: Ventricular rate(beats/min), RR, PR interval(msec), QRS duration(msec), QTcB and QTcF were recorded. The results of 12-lead ECG will be categorized Normal/Abnormal NCS(No clinically significant)/Abnormal CS(clinically significant).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Laboratory results
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day -2 (Randomization) to Day 60 (Post-study visit of Part I) and Day 42 (Follow up visit of Part II)
primary_outcome.description: Hematology, Blood chemistry, Coagulation and Urinalysis were tested. The Average, Median, Standard Deviation, Min, Max values will be calculated to assess the safety/tolerability.

arm_group.description: Part I: A-B-D-C A: DWP14012 A mg bid B: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid C: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid D: Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid

Part I: B-C-A-D A: DWP14012 A mg bid B: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid C: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid D: Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid

Part I: C-D-B-A A: DWP14012 A mg bid B: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid C: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid D: Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid

Part I: D-A-C-B A: DWP14012 A mg bid B: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid C: DWP14012 A mg bid + Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid D: Clarithromycin 500 mg bid + Amoxicillin 1 g bid
Part II: (DWP14012 B mg + Clarithromycin 500 mg + Amoxicillin 1g) bid
Part II: (DWP14012 A mg + Clarithromycin 500 mg + Amoxicillin 1g) bid
Part II: (Lansoprazole 30 mg + Clarithromycin 500 mg + Amoxicillin 1g) bid

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult males aged between 19 and 50 at screening
- Those whose weight is between 55 and 90 kg and BMI is between 18.0 and 27.0
- Part I: Those who have been helicobacter pylori negative at screening Part II: Those who have been helicobacter pylori positive at screening
- Those who are adequate to be subjects in this study upon judgment of the investigator after physical examination, clinical laboratory test, examination by interview, etc
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those who have clinical significant liver, kidney, nervous system, respiratory, endocrine, hematology and oncology, cardiovascular, urinary, and mental diseases or past history
- Those who have gastrointestinal diseases or past history of gastrointestinal diseases (gastrointestinal ulcer, gastritis, gastrospasm, gastroesophageal reflux, Crohn's disease etc.) that may affect safety and pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic evaluation of study drug, and those who have past history of gastrointestinal surgery (however, except simple appendectomy and herniotomy)
- Those whose plasma AST (SGOT) and ALT (SGPT) exceed to the upper limit of the normal range
- Those who have anatomical disability in insertion and maintenance of pH meter catheter
